creator: dave@lledr-solutions.co.uk
text:
The Bitflux editor comes up, but doesn't allow any editing, using Firefox 1.0.3
on Windows XP (no other OS tested). It works normally with Firefox 1.0.1 on
Windows 2000 (no other OS tested). There are Javascript errors given (below). I
have posted this bug in the hope that other people can test it as well.

Javascript error:
Error: uncaught exception: [Exception... "Illegal operation on WrappedNative
prototype object"  nsresult: "0x8057000c (NS_ERROR_XPC_BAD_OP_ON_WN_PROTO)" 
location: "JS frame :: http://localhost:8080/lenya/bxeng/mozile/domlevel3.js ::
anonymous :: line 258"  data: no]

creator: renaud.richardet@gmail.com
text:
The bug is caused by a "badly" implemented security fix on Firefox, see
http://blog.bitflux.ch/archive/bxe-on-firefox-1-0-3-no-workie-.html 
As the title says, there seems to be no workaroud ATM.
